articles.headline: Billions to Connect Everyone to High-Speed Internet Could Still Fall Short
articles.snippet: President Biden has promised to provide every American access to reliable high-speed internet. But some have raised concerns about whether the funds will achieve all of the administration’s goals.
articles.abstract: President Biden has promised to provide every American access to reliable high-speed internet. But some have raised concerns about whether the funds will achieve all of the administration’s goals.
articles.lead_paragraph: Along the southeastern edge of Oklahoma, where expansive cattle ranches and empty storefronts dot the landscape, the lack of high-speed internet service has become a daily frustration for residents.

articles.headline: Instacart Rises 12% on First Day of Trading, an Encouraging Sign for Tech I.P.O.s
articles.snippet: Shares opened at $42 on Tuesday before declining, valuing the grocery delivery company at $11.1 billion.
articles.abstract: Shares opened at $42 on Tuesday before declining, valuing the grocery delivery company at $11.1 billion.
articles.lead_paragraph: Initial public offerings are back, warts and all.
articles.byline: By Erin Griffith and Kellen Browning

articles.headline: Anti-Affirmative Action Group Sues West Point Over Admissions Policy
articles.snippet: The Supreme Court ruling barring race-conscious admissions at civilian colleges should apply to the U.S. Military Academy as well, the lawsuit argues.
articles.abstract: The Supreme Court ruling barring race-conscious admissions at civilian colleges should apply to the U.S. Military Academy as well, the lawsuit argues.
articles.lead_paragraph: The group that won a major Supreme Court victory against affirmative action in June sued the U.S. Military Academy at West Point on Tuesday, arguing that the court’s ruling barring race-conscious college admissions should extend to the nation’s military academies as well.

articles.headline: New York Loves to Hate Him. Can a $2.3 Billion Sphere Redeem Jim Dolan?
articles.snippet: Mr. Dolan, who controls the company that owns the Knicks and the Rangers, is set to open a behemoth arena in Las Vegas that he hopes will revolutionize live entertainment. Back home in New York, he is facing the wrath of lawyers, politicians and s...
articles.abstract: Mr. Dolan, who controls the company that owns the Knicks and the Rangers, is set to open a behemoth arena in Las Vegas that he hopes will revolutionize live entertainment. Back home in New York, he is facing the wrath of lawyers, politicians and sports fans.
articles.lead_paragraph: In his 26th-floor office, high above Midtown Manhattan, James L. Dolan sits on a white couch by a large desk and armoire decorated with family photographs, with an electric guitar on a stand in the corner. His eyes are trained on a wall-mounted surveillance screen.

articles.headline: Fed Aims for Soft Landing With a Rate Pause and a Pledge to Move ‘Carefully’
articles.snippet: Central bankers held rates steady at 5.25 to 5.5 percent, and forecast that they could still make a final quarter-point-rate move this year.
articles.abstract: Central bankers held rates steady at 5.25 to 5.5 percent, and forecast that they could still make a final quarter-point-rate move this year.
articles.lead_paragraph: Federal Reserve officials left interest rates unchanged on Wednesday and released a roundly optimistic set of economic forecasts that showed inflation fading more swiftly this year even with a solidly growing economy.

articles.headline: Gas Prices Have Crept Higher This Summer, a Challenge for the Fed
articles.snippet: Now at their highest level in 11 months, they can complicate the Federal Reserve’s campaign to rein in inflation.
articles.abstract: Now at their highest level in 11 months, they can complicate the Federal Reserve’s campaign to rein in inflation.
articles.lead_paragraph: Your eyes are not deceiving you: Gas prices are rising yet again. On Wednesday, the national average for unleaded gasoline was $3.88 per gallon, according to AAA, the highest level in nearly a year.

articles.headline: Garland Rebuffs Republicans’ Efforts to Reveal Details on Hunter Biden Inquiry
articles.snippet: The soft-spoken attorney general struck a sharper tone during testimony before the Judiciary Committee, saying prosecutors won’t be “intimidated” by threats from Trump allies.
articles.abstract: The soft-spoken attorney general struck a sharper tone during testimony before the Judiciary Committee, saying prosecutors won’t be “intimidated” by threats from Trump allies.
articles.lead_paragraph: Attorney General Merrick B. Garland offered a fiery defense of the Justice Department’s investigation of Hunter Biden on Wednesday, telling a House committee he was “not Congress’s prosecutor” — and would not reveal details of the inquiry no matter how much pressure lawmakers applied.

articles.headline: Navigating a Perilous Mountain Pass After a Devastating Earthquake
articles.snippet: A stretch of lonely road across Morocco’s Atlas Mountains has long been known for its stunning views and perilous turns. After the earthquake, it became a lifeline for dozens of destroyed villages.
articles.abstract: A stretch of lonely road across Morocco’s Atlas Mountains has long been known for its stunning views and perilous turns. After the earthquake, it became a lifeline for dozens of destroyed villages.
articles.lead_paragraph: Climbing up around 7,000 feet over the Atlas Mountains, the road through the Tizi N’Test pass bends impossibly around cliff edges, expands and pinches uncomfortably to a single fragile track and creeps under jagged rocky outcrops.
articles.byline: By Catherine Porter, Aida Alami and Nariman El-Mofty

articles.headline: Google Says Switching Away From Its Search Engine Is Easy. It’s Not.
articles.snippet: Google says a change takes just a few steps, but a panel of designers found otherwise. The issue is at the heart of a federal antitrust trial.
articles.abstract: Google says a change takes just a few steps, but a panel of designers found otherwise. The issue is at the heart of a federal antitrust trial.
articles.lead_paragraph: Imagine if every time you went to the supermarket, your shopping cart came loaded with the same box of cereal.
